techmeme.title: SignalFire: startups and Big Tech firms cut hiring of recent graduates by 11% and 25% respectively in 2024 vs. 2023, as AI can handle routine, low-risk tasks (Marina Temkin/TechCrunch)
Sources: Unacademy cofounder Gaurav Munjal is stepping down as CEO, as the company pivots to in-person coaching centers and its Duolingo-like learning app (Samidha Sharma/The Economic Times)
The EU has published its April 23 decision to fine Apple €500M for DMA non-compliance; Apple has until end of June to be in compliance or face periodic fines (Marcus Mendes/9to5Mac)
Circle's S-1 shows that 60% of the 24M shares being sold in its IPO come from existing stakeholders rather than the company, a highly unusual move in a tech IPO (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Okta reports Q1 revenue up 12% YoY to $688M, vs. $680M est., and maintains its FY 2026 guidance due to macroeconomic uncertainties; OKTA drops 12%+ after hours (Samantha Subin/CNBC)
